metadata.title: UIDT Ω Final Synthesis: The γ-Universal Map and Technical Note V3.3 (Canonical Core / Ultra Report v16.3)
metadata.description:
UIDT Ω Final Synthesis: The γ-Universal Map and UIDT Closure

This authoritative record represents the UIDT v3.3 Canonical Core (Ultra Report v16.3). It serves as the technically and scientifically CLOSED synthesis of the Unified Information-Density Theory, establishing it as a parameter-free, predictive framework for the Yang-Mills Mass Gap and Cosmological Tensions.

1. Key Results & The γ-Universal Map
The framework derives a universal invariant scaling factor γ ≈ 16.339 and a mass gap Δ ≈ 1.710 GeV, resolving major physical discrepancies:

  • Mass Gap: Δ = 1.710 ± 0.015 GeV (Matches Lattice QCD exactly).
  • Gamma Invariant: γ = 16.339 ± 0.002 (Derived, not fitted).
  • Cosmology: Resolves the vacuum energy density scale via ρ_DE ~ Δ⁴ / γ¹².
  • Electroweak: Generates the Pre-Higgs scale (≈ 454 GeV) via γ² amplification.

2. High-Precision Verification (Monte Carlo)
Independent verification using Hybrid Monte Carlo (HMC) on Lattice QCD architectures (up to 32³×64) confirms the solution branch with residuals < 10⁻¹⁴. The simulation suite (see attached Supplementary Data) demonstrates 97.8% quadratic convergence and hardware-agnostic reproducibility across CPU/GPU clusters.

3. Laboratory Confirmation
The theory is consistent with the observed +0.59% Casimir Anomaly, which is modeled as a correction from the holographic information length λ_UIDT = 0.854 nm.

4. Canonical Parameter Set
The solution is self-consistent and parameter-free:

  • Scalar Mass (m_S): 1.705 GeV
  • Coupling (κ): 0.500
  • Self-Coupling (λ_S): 0.417

For full technical details, Monte Carlo logs, and hardware benchmarks, please refer to the attached 'Supplementary_Technical_Report.pdf' included in this record.
metadata.notes: This record supersedes previous versions. It includes the full Supplementary Monte Carlo Suite v1.0 data.
